intro: Funkia sieboldiana var. lancifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf daylily, is a perennial plant native to East Asia. It features lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are broad at the base and taper toward the tip. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sun. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability in garden settings.
